page.title: 08POLLUTION
page.content: Farmers are now prepared to make extensive use of pesticides, herbicides and other chemicals in order to improve the amount and quality of their crop yields. These sprays are most often water soluble for ease of application and it is inevitable that many of the chemical products thus applied find their way via rain water run-off into the small streams and burns. Chemicals have had this effect on the Kenley Burn which is suffering from the effects of chemical pollution. The growth of algae, particularly at the mouth of the burn, has greatly increased indicating the excessive presence of nitrates in the water. This reduces the oxygen level in the water and there is a subsequent decrease in fish life. The algae is, in effect, choking the burn to death.
